error.address: Invalid remote address specified. Address must be an IP address or a resolvable hostname.
error.address_in_use: The selected listening port is already in use on this system.
error.model: The selected model doesn't seem to support MODBUS40
error.read: Error on read request from pump. Verify your `Remote read port` or `Remote address`.
error.url: The specified URL is not well formed nor supported
error.write: Error on write request to pump. Verify your `Remote write port` or `Remote address`.

data_description.modbus_unit: Unit identification for your heat pump. Can usually be left at 0.
data_description.modbus_url:
Modbus URL that describes the connection to your heat pump or MODBUS40 unit. It should be in the form:
 - `{tcp}` for Modbus TCP connection
 - `{serial}` for a local Modbus RTU connection
 - `{rfc2217}` for a remote Telnet-based Modbus RTU connection.

data_description.ip_address: The address of the NibeGW unit. The device should have been configured with a static address.
data_description.listening_port: The local port on this system, that the NibeGW unit is configured to send data to.
data_description.remote_read_port: The port the NibeGW unit is listening for read requests on.
data_description.remote_write_port: The port the NibeGW unit is listening for write requests on.

nibegw.description:
Before attempting to configure the integration, verify that:
 - The NibeGW unit is connected to a heat pump.
 - The MODBUS40 accessory has been enabled in the heat pump configuration.
 - The pump has not gone into an alarm state about missing MODBUS40 accessory.

user.description: Pick the connection method to your pump. In general, F-series pumps require a NibeGW custom accessory, while an S-series pump has Modbus support built-in.

write_failed.message: Writing of coil {address} with value `{value}` failed with error `{error}`
